meanings.definition: The act or process of changing from one thing to another.
meanings.sent1: During the game, the team made several changeovers in their lineup.
meanings.sent2: The changeovers in the weather from sunny to rainy caught everyone by surprise.
meanings.sent3: The constant changeovers in the TV show's plot kept the viewers on their toes.
meanings.sent4: Her frequent changeovers in hairstyles reflected her ever-evolving personality.
meanings.sent5: The sudden changeovers in traffic patterns made the commute unpredictable.

meanings.definition: A shift or transition from one state or condition to another.
meanings.sent1: The changeovers in leadership brought a fresh perspective to the company.
meanings.sent2: The changeovers in temperature signaled the arrival of a new season.
meanings.sent3: The changeovers in flavors in the dish created a delightful culinary experience.
meanings.sent4: The changeovers in music genres at the concert catered to diverse tastes.
meanings.sent5: The changeovers in scenery along the road trip made it an exciting journey.
